HomePage.cta_title: Ready for an Amazing Student Experience?
HomePage.cta_description: Join thousands of international students using our platform to make the most of their Canadian education journey.
HomePage.faq_description: Answers to common questions from international students
HomePage.faq1_question: How do I find student discounts near my campus?
HomePage.faq1_answer: Use the 'Student Discounts' filter on the Campus Explorer map to see all businesses offering special deals for students with valid ID.
HomePage.faq2_question: Are there student groups for international students?
HomePage.faq2_answer: Yes! Check the 'Student Community' section to find groups specific to your nationality, field of study, or interests.
HomePage.faq3_question: How can I find affordable student housing?
HomePage.faq3_answer: Our Housing section features verified student housing options, roommate matching, and tips for finding affordable accommodations near campus.
HomePage.faq4_question: Can I get help with my student visa or study permit?
HomePage.faq4_answer: Absolutely! Our resources section includes guides on extending study permits, working while studying, and transitioning to post-graduation work permits.
HomePage.newsletter_description: Get the latest student events, scholarship opportunities, and campus news delivered to your inbox.

about.hero_description: Supporting International Students in Canada Since 2020
about.mission_description_1: Newcomers Canada Hub was created with a simple yet powerful purpose: to help international students and newcomers settle in Canada with confidence and ease. We understand that arriving in a new country can be overwhelming, with countless services to navigate and information to absorb.
about.mission_description_2: That's why we've built a comprehensive resource that aggregates all essential services—from government agencies and banks to grocery stores and transportation options—into one user-friendly platform. Our goal is to eliminate the stress of finding critical information during your transition period.
about.did_you_know_description: Over 500,000 international students and newcomers arrive in Canada each year. Our platform is designed to support every one of them in their journey to build a new life in Canada.
about.how_we_help_title: How We Help You Settle In
about.card_1_description: We've gathered all essential services—from government agencies like Service Canada and Service Ontario to banks, grocery stores, and transportation options—into one convenient platform, eliminating the need to search across multiple websites.
about.card_2_description: Our interactive map shows you the nearest service locations based on your current position, helping you quickly find what you need whether you're looking for a bank, grocery store, or government office.
about.card_3_description: We include specialized services for newcomers, including international money transfer operations like LEMFI and Africhange, making it easier to manage finances between Canada and your home country.
about.story_description_1: Newcomers Canada Hub was founded by a team of immigrants who experienced firsthand the challenges of settling in a new country. We remember the confusion of finding essential services, the frustration of navigating government websites, and the anxiety of setting up basic necessities like banking and groceries.
about.story_description_2: Drawing from our personal experiences, we created this platform to help others avoid the same difficulties. Our team includes professionals with backgrounds in immigration services, technology, and community outreach, all dedicated to making the transition to life in Canada as smooth as possible.
about.story_description_3: Today, we continue to expand our services based on user feedback, regularly updating our database of resources and improving our platform to better serve the diverse needs of newcomers from around the world.
about.community_description: Whether you're just starting your academic journey or looking to make the most of your Canadian education experience, we're here to support you every step of the way.

faqs.hero_description: Answers to common questions from international students in Canada
faqs.faq1_question: What is Newcomers Canada Hub for students?
faqs.faq1_answer: Newcomers Canada Hub is a comprehensive platform designed specifically for international students in Canada. We provide information about campus resources, student housing, academic support, student discounts, and essential services to help you thrive during your studies in Canada.
faqs.faq2_question: How can I find student housing near my campus?
faqs.faq2_answer: Our platform offers a dedicated student housing section where you can find on-campus residence options, off-campus apartments, roommate matching services, and temporary accommodations. You can filter by price range, distance from campus, and amenities to find the perfect student housing.
faqs.faq3_question: What student discounts are available through your platform?
faqs.faq3_answer: We maintain a comprehensive database of student discounts across Canada, including deals on textbooks, technology, food, entertainment, transportation, and more. Simply show your valid student ID at participating locations or use our exclusive discount codes online.
faqs.faq4_question: How can I connect with other students from my country?
faqs.faq4_answer: Our student community section allows you to find and join cultural associations, international student groups, and country-specific clubs at your university. You can also participate in virtual and in-person meetups organized through our events calendar.
faqs.faq5_question: What academic resources are available for international students?
faqs.faq5_answer: We provide information about tutoring services, writing centers, study groups, library resources, and academic workshops specifically designed for international students. Many of these resources offer specialized support for English language learners.
faqs.faq6_question: How do I find on-campus jobs and internships?
faqs.faq6_answer: Our career resources section includes listings for on-campus jobs, work-study positions, co-op placements, and internships suitable for international students. We also provide information about work permits, SIN applications, and employment regulations for students.
faqs.faq7_question: Are there scholarships available for international students?
faqs.faq7_answer: Yes! Our scholarship finder tool helps you discover scholarships, grants, bursaries, and financial aid opportunities specifically for international students. We provide application guidance, deadline reminders, and tips for writing successful scholarship essays.
faqs.faq8_question: How can I navigate the Canadian healthcare system as a student?
faqs.faq8_answer: We offer comprehensive guides to student health insurance plans, campus health services, walk-in clinics, hospitals, and pharmacies near major universities. Our resources explain how to access mental health support, emergency services, and specialized care.
faqs.faq9_question: What support is available for students struggling with coursework?
faqs.faq9_answer: Our platform connects you with academic advisors, tutoring services, study skills workshops, and peer mentors who can help with challenging courses. We also provide resources for time management, exam preparation, and addressing language barriers in academic settings.
faqs.faq10_question: How can I get involved in campus activities and events?
faqs.faq10_answer: Our events calendar features orientation activities, cultural celebrations, networking opportunities, workshops, and social gatherings happening on campuses across Canada. You can filter events by location, interest, and whether they're specifically for international students.
faqs.faq11_question: What should I do if I'm experiencing culture shock or homesickness?
faqs.faq11_answer: We provide resources for mental health support, cultural adjustment workshops, and community connections to help you navigate the challenges of studying abroad. Many campuses offer counseling services specifically for international students dealing with culture shock, homesickness, or adjustment difficulties.
faqs.faq12_question: How can I prepare for post-graduation work and immigration options?
faqs.faq12_answer: Our career development section includes information about post-graduation work permits, Canadian experience class immigration pathways, networking opportunities, and job search strategies for international graduates. We also connect students with immigration consultants and career advisors specializing in international student transitions.
faqs.contact_description: Our student support team is ready to help with any questions about your Canadian education journey.
